results.title: The Hobbit
results.creator_credit: Arthur Rankin Jnr, Jules Bass and Rankin-Bass Productions
results.brief_description: Bilbo Baggins journeys into the Middle Earth, a place inhabited by Elves, dwarves, Wizards, Goblins, Dragons and Hobbits in an effort to reclaim the gold of the Dwarf King. It is an adventurous journey and a battle between the forces of Evil. This animated feature based on J.R.R. Tolkien’s timeless classic features the voices of John Huston (Gandalf the Grey), Otto Preminger (Elvenking) and Orson Bean (Bilbo Baggins).
results.creator_credit_for_label: Arthur Rankin Jnr, Jules Bass and Rankin-Bass Productions
results.description:
Bilbo Baggins journeys into Middle Earth, a place inhabited by elves, dwarves, wizards, goblins, dragons and hobbits, in an effort to reclaim the gold of the Dwarf King.

It’s an adventurous journey that features a battle between the forces of good and evil. This animated feature based on JRR Tolkien’s timeless classic features the voices of John Huston (Gandalf the Grey), Otto Preminger (Elvenking) and Orson Bean (Bilbo Baggins).

results.title: The History of pornography (E)
results.brief_description: This film documents the blazen and colourful history of pornography. It begins with primitive hard-core cave etchings, and the sublime prose and erotica of ancient China and India, progressing to the uncontrolled excesses of the Roman Empire and early European erotica. It also covers the first legalising of “porn” in Denmark, after a sexual revolution that challenged its constitutional laws. The rapid emergence of “dirty” comics and cartoons, and early underground “stag” films area also represented. The documentary finishes with an exploration of today’s mass marketing of sex.

results.title: The History of the Harley Davidson
results.creator_credit: Gary Legon, Sarah Legon and Estate Films
results.brief_description: The Harley-Davidson has legendary status. It has grown from cult appeal to mass appeal. Kids dream about them and grandparents own them. Harley is more than a motorcycle - it’s a state of mind. This program is both a history of the Harley-Davidson motorcycle and a visual feast containing fantastic shots of old, new and limited edition Harleys. Harley enthusiasts will revel in the adoration of their dream-machines, and those interested in the historical development of motor vehicles in society will be fascinated by this tribute to one of the main forms of transport. Harley loyalists run the gamut from celebrities, to librarians, to the guy down the street. Harley-Davidson will always stand for freedom, independence and the open road. Its place in history is assured. It remains, and will forever be a legend.

results.title: The Heatwave lasted four days
results.creator_credit: Douglas Jackson and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: A few meters of film, the tempting lure of several thousand dollars, and a television-news cameraman with a weakness for wine, women and cars becomes an accomplice in crime. In this fast-moving murder feature, which links intrigue with intrigue, we witness the progressive ruination of a man who can find no way out.

results.title: The Hermitage: art treasures tour (PC)
results.brief_description: This interactive CD-ROM takes the viewer on a tour of the State Hermitage Museum, St Petersburg, Russia. The museum was built during the 18th century to house the private art collection of the Tsars, today it houses more than 3,000,000 artefacts from Prehistory to Modern Day. You can take your pick of video clips about Rembrandt, French, Roman and Italian Art; look at music and the arts, in particular Rachmaninoff and Tchaikovsky; take guided tours of Russian, Western European and Oriental Art, the Golden Chamber, architecture, art of classical antiquity; as well as looking through maps and essays written by museum experts.

results.title: ACMI in the regions: Stories from Wangaratta
results.creator_credit: Csilla Csongvay, Roberto Salvatore, ACMI Content Development, Shelley Matulick and ACMI
results.brief_description: This program contains nine stories about residents from around the Wangaratta region in north-eastern Victoria. Covering the towns of Eldorado, King Valley, Greta, Whitfield and Whitlands, locals tell stories about their lives and their connection to the land and the community.

results.title: The Herd
results.creator_credit: Peter Lynch, Peter Starr and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: In 1929, 62 year old Andy Bahr completed a 2,400 kilometre journey across the hostile and unmapped terrain of Alaska. What was remarkable about the journey that he completed with a team of Inuit and Sami herders, was that they herded 3,000 reindeer along the way. The Canadian government, in a well intentioned move to provide a livelihood for the Mackenzie Delta Inuit, had purchased the herd, which now required transportation. The drive was expected to take 18 months; it lasted 6 years. Filmed on location from the Bering Strait in Alaska to the Beaufort Sea in the Northwest Territories, this stunning odyssey combines historical documentation, epic myth and irreverent humour to follow Bahr’s quest to the edge of the world.

results.title: The Hacktivists [Widescreen]
results.creator_credit: Ian Walker, Chris Hilton, Laurnet Bocahut, Peter Day, Dominant 7 and Hilton Cordell
results.brief_description: This documentary - an Australian/French co-production - examines Internet based civil action and protests, and the individuals who invent and co-ordinate such exploits. Known as hacktivists, the intention of these protestors is to disrupt business, such as e-commerce and prevent websites from operating effectively. The hacktivists (who range across the globe) are principally concerned with globalisation and capitalism. Their perception is that they are modern dissidents whose activities sit alongside, even boost and support, traditional forms of street protest. In this documentary, several hacktivists are interviewed, discussing their aims, politics and methodology, which may include bombarding companies with emails or performing cyber sit-ins, immobilising a website. These activities are not only effective but also pose a danger to big corporations with net-based trade. There are also interviews with the Canadian police and a cyber expert employed by companies to anticipate and undermine hacktivist activities. One mission of online activism is to explain the philosophy to ordinary people and encourage them to take part. Electro-hippies (as they are known) believe that electronic forms of protest will become even more effective as their methods improve and e-commerce expands. The war looks set to continue.

results.title: The Harder they come [DVD]
results.brief_description: The first independent feature film produced in Jamaica gave many Americans their first taste of reggae music with musician Jimmy Cliff in the title role, backed by a fabulous reggae soundtrack. Cliff plays Ivan, a naive rural singer who moves to the city in search of fame but is soon impoverished and exploited by the music industry before becoming embroiled in the trade of marijuana and murder; simultaneously Ivan’s music is released to great acclaim and he becomes somewhat of a local anti-hero. As well as offering a unique view of the reggae scene the milieu of this film also offers a de-romanticised view of seedy Kingston life. Indeed Henzell’s style borders on documentary, as he evokes the squalor of the street, the impoverishment of the people and the multi-faceted systemic corruption. Soundtrack includes the title track as well as other reggae hits “You Can Really Get It if You Want It”, “Sitting in Limbo” and “Johnny Too Bad”. Cast includes Basil Keane, Ras Daniel Hartman, Winston Stona, Janet Barkley, Bobby Charlton and Carl Bradshaw.

results.title: The Handmaid's tale
results.creator_credit: Volker Schlondorff, Daniel Wilson and Cinecom Entertainment Group
results.brief_description: In the near future, the air and water is poisoned, the result is sterility. Only one out of a hundred women can still bear children and some women stopped, believing there would be no future. The solution; to create an army of ‘handmaids’, an involuntary, semi-religious order of women who exist solely to bear children for the rich, powerful ruling class. Kate (Natasha Richardson) becomes a victim of this cruel and backward world, where women are divided into three kinds, Handmaids, Wives or Prostitutes. A chilling look at a possible future. Based on the novel by Margaret Atwood. Screenplay by Harold Pinter. Cast also includes Victoria Tennant, Faye Dunaway, Elizabeth McGovern, Aidan Quinn and Robert Duvall.
